channel.title: Help with Handlers
channel.description:
i was writing up the herblore in my client.java and this came up..
client.java:16042: code too large public void parseIncomingPackets(){ ^ Note: stream:java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .
I'm assuming this means that there's too much junk in my client.java class, and am trying to get some guidance as to writing handlers in separate text files for skill classes. that way they don't have to take up so much space in my client.java haha.. any help would be much appreciated, my msn -- drs023@hotmail.com, or log onto my private server with any client (most basic ones are compatible) -- warrscape.no-ip.org

item.title: Help with Handlers
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Must be delta. Ew. Writing any handlers for delta is hard, because u have to succesfully delete the old skill. Handlers are fairly simple, they just do it, ill help you in, ehh, 20 minutes or so
Added you on msn

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Handlers
item.dc:creator: @warrsaw warrsaw
item.description:
@warrsaw wrote:

i was writing up the herblore in my client.java and this came up…

client.java:16042: code too large
public void parseIncomingPackets(){
^
Note: stream:java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Compiling Finished.
Press any key to continue . . .

I’m assuming this means that there’s too much junk in my client.java class,
and am trying to get some guidance as to writing handlers in separate text files
for skill classes.
that way they don’t have to take up so much space in my client.java haha…
any help would be much appreciated,
my msn – drs023@hotmail.com,
or log onto my private server with any client (most basic ones are compatible)
– warrscape.no-ip.org
